New Records: Aaron Judge hit his 52nd home run of the season, breaking his career-long home run drought.
The New York Yankees achieved their largest division lead since June 14 by being three games up on the Orioles in the American League East.
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge hit a go-ahead grand slam in the seventh inning off left-hander Cam Booser.
Zack Kelly opened the inning with two walks and permitted a Gleyber Torres run-scoring single.
Luke Weaver struck out the side in the eighth and ninth innings to secure the save.
Pre-Game Insights: Yankees pitcher Clarke Schmidt commented on Aaron Judge's performance, noting that it was hard to ignore the home run drought.
Manager Aaron Boone discussed the team's strategy and preparation for the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Aaron Boone expressed pride in the team's comeback win and highlighted the significance of the victory.
Aaron Judge downplayed his home run drought, emphasizing that he focuses on performance rather than stats.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The crowd at Yankee Stadium erupted after Judge's grand slam, with chants of 'M-V-P!' following his at-bat.
The game's outcome improved the Yankees' standings and showcased the team's resilience.
